info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 3:35PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hampshire and central Franklin Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 335 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Whately, or 9 miles north of Northampton, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Amherst, Greenfield, Deerfield, Montague, Hadley, Sunderland, Hatfield, Williamsburg, Bernardston, Conway, Shelburne, Leverett, Shutesbury, Ashfield, Colrain, Gill, Whately, Pelham, Goshen, and Leyden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
